TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CosmosAliasManager extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A stateful manager for SQL aliases, capable of generating uniquified source aliases and rewriting them in post-processing. An instance of is valid for a single query compilation, and is owned by .
Docs.remarks: This is an internal API that supports the Entity Framework Core infrastructure and not subject to the same compatibility standards as public APIs. It may be changed or removed without notice in any release. You should only use it directly in your code with extreme caution and knowing that doing so can result in application failures when updating to a new Entity Framework Core release.

Docs.param: A name (e.g. of a container) to use as the starting point for the alias; a number postfix will be appended to it as necessary.
Docs.summary: Generates an alias based on the given . All aliases produced by a given instance of are unique.
Docs.returns: A fully unique alias within the context of this translation process.

Docs.param: An expression to use as the starting point for the alias; this method knows a number of well-known expression types and can generate appropriate aliases for them. A number postfix will be appended to it as necessary.
If isn't a well-known expression type, this fallback string will be used.
Docs.summary: Generates an alias based on the given . All aliases produced by a given instance of are unique.

Docs.summary: Performs a post-processing pass over aliases in the provided SQL tree, closing any gaps.
Docs.remarks: This is an internal API that supports the Entity Framework Core infrastructure and not subject to the same compatibility standards as public APIs. abstract member RemapSourceAliases : System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlySet<string> -> System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<string, string> override this.RemapSourceAliases : System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlySet<string> -> System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<string, string>

Docs.summary: Given the list of source aliases currently in use in the SQL tree, produces a remapping for aliases within that list. Can be used to e.g. close gaps for sources which have been pruned, etc.
Docs.remarks: This is an internal API that supports the Entity Framework Core infrastructure and not subject to the same compatibility standards as public APIs. It may be changed or removed without notice in any release. You should only use it directly in your code with extreme caution and knowing that doing so can result in application failures when updating to a new Entity Framework Core release.
